author: Sam S.

review: To get to the nitty gritty....Pros:- lots of features, such as Netflix, Twitch, YouTube, game apps, and of course Amazon- Small and hides well. Powered from the USB port on my Samsung HDTV.Cons:- runs a tad slow at times; the menu can get choppy when browsing- can get very warm/hot, probably causing some of the choppiness when browsing- the remote is cheap - I truly hate to say that, as I absolutely adore Amazon however, the remote is not well made. It's cheap plastic, and many, many times when clicking the side buttons to browse different apps, it's as if the button gets stuck and rapidly moves through all the menus. Also, every time I click a button on the remote, it's like the whole thing gets "squished", and the plastic feels like it's grinding together.- the netflix app has closed out several times with an error code (I don't have it up at the moment, so I can't recall exactly what it is.Would I recommend this? Possibly....I don't know. The remote needs improvement, and the stick needs some more speed behind it.mOn a side note, I am an IT professional, and the Internet strength in my house is excellent. As a comparison, my PS3 never (I literately mean that - never) has issues streaming Amazon Videos or Netflix. Obviously they're two completely different systems, but the Fire TV Stick needs some software enhancements and/or hardware improvements.
